page.title: 08HITCHIN BY-PASS (2)
page.content: However, the planning and building of this Relief road proved to be very controversial.A By_pass for Hitchin had been talked about way back in the 1920's and although central government agreed to such a road as long ago as 1958, it was not until 1971 that the government approved its location.Since then cash cutbacks and doubts about the proposed route resulted in more delays and a public enquiry in Sept 1979. Objections ranged from the cost of the scheme, the disappearance of listed buildings, fears of town centre road closures resulting in loss of business,the disturbance of old people's homes,fear of subway muggers, to the more practical problem of what to do with 70,000 tons of earth! All these problems were finally overcome or partially resolved and the By_pass is now well established.
